channel.title: Dependencies on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Dependencies on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: Everything depends on the latest version of everything else
item.description: This seems to be the state of the software development world, where you really only have two states of affairs: State one is really old, stable, standardized, “legacy” code, well documented, portable, runs everywhere, easy to port to new systems and architectures. The “curl” library is probably the archetype of this, written in C. State two is really new, unstable, exciting, “modern” code, always changing, designed largely for a 64-bit Intel architecture, and unpredictably hard or easy to port to new systems and architectures.
